p.d: A group of Acadians from Canada and the US arrive in Belle-Île-en-Mer, off the Breton coast, to celebrate the 250th anniversary of their ancestors' arrival on this French island. Though separated by two and a half centuries and 4,500 kilometres, these "Acadian Bellilois" maintain close links with their cultural heritage. Directed by: Phil Comeau (Canada, 2016) Awards: Jury special mention at the Cinema on the Bayou festival in Louisiana (USA), Award of excellence at the Best Shorts Competition in San Diego (USA), Best Short film at the French language cinema festival in Acadia (Canada)
